title: Tata Motors shares gain 3.01%, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Tata Motors were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 in Monday's session, trading at Rs 712.55, a 3.01% increase. Other top gainers on the Nifty 50 included Hero Motocorp, Tata Steel, JSW Steel and M&M. Tata Motors recently made several corporate announcements. On September 3, 2025, the company announced a virtual group meeting of analysts and institutional investors scheduled for September 12, 2025, at 6:30 p.m. (IST). Earlier, on September 1, 2025, Tata Motors released a statement by Jaguar Land Rover Automotive, Plc, UK (JLR) regarding an IT security incident at JLR. On the same day, the company issued a press release titled ''Tata Motors Monthly Sales - August 2025''. Tata Motors has a history of rewarding its investors with dividends. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share on May 13, 2025, which was paid out on June 4, 2025. In addition, the company announced a split with new face value of Rs. 2 from old face value of Rs 10 on September 12, 2011. Here's a look at Tata Motors' financial performance over the past few years:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)2021249,794.75-13,016.14-36.992022278,453.62-11,234.70-29.882023345,966.962,353.496.292024437,927.7731,106.9581.952025439,695.0022,991.0078.80The consolidated annual revenue for Tata Motors increased from Rs 249,794.75 Crore in 2021 to Rs 439,695.00 Crore in 2025. The net profit also improved, going from a loss of Rs 13,016.14 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 22,991.00 Crore in 2025. The company's income statement provides further insights into its financial performance. Here’s an overview of Tata Motors' Consolidated Income Statement:ParticularsMar 2025 (Rs Crore)Mar 2024 (Rs Crore)Mar 2023 (Rs Crore)Mar 2022 (Rs Crore)Mar 2021 (Rs Crore)Sales439,695437,927345,966278,453249,794Other Income6,2445,9494,6333,0532,643Total Income445,939443,877350,600281,507252,437Total Expenditure407,363406,636337,317279,198254,815EBIT38,57637,24113,2832,308-2,377Interest5,0839,98510,2259,3118,097Tax10,502-3,8517044,2312,541Net Profit22,99131,1062,353-11,234-13,016Tata Motors has consistently generated positive cash flow from operating activities. The cash flow from operating activities was Rs 63,102 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, as compared to Rs 67,915 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Tata Motors is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. According to Moneycontrol analysis, the sentiment for Tata Motors was bullish as of September 1, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 712.55, Tata Motors has shown a positive move, driven by a combination of recent announcements and overall market dynamics.

title: Honeywell Automation shares rise 2.06% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Honeywell Automation gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 36,130 on Monday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Honeywell Automation's standalone revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,183 Crore. The company reported other income of Rs 41 Crore and total income of Rs 1,224 Crore for the same period. Total expenditure for the quarter was Rs 1,055 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 169 Crore. The company's interest came in at Rs 1 Crore and tax at Rs 43 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 124 Crore. The standalone revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 1,114 Crore, compared to Rs 1,090 Crore for December 2024, Rs 1,023 Crore for September 2024, and Rs 960 Crore for June 2024. Honeywell Automation's standalone annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 4,189 Crore. Other income stood at Rs 182 Crore, bringing the total income to Rs 4,371 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 3,659 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 712 Crore. Interest paid was Rs 6 Crore and tax was Rs 182 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 523 Crore. The standalone annual revenue for the year-ending March 2024 was Rs 4,058 Crore, compared to Rs 3,447 Crore for March 2023, Rs 2,948 Crore for March 2022 and Rs 3,042 Crore for March 2021. Key financial metrics include Basic Earnings Per Share (EPS) and Diluted EPS, both reported at Rs 592.15 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 567.13 in March 2024, Rs 495.40 in March 2023, Rs 383.57 in March 2022 and Rs 520.32 in March 2021. The Book Value per share was Rs 4,588.86 for March 2025, up from Rs 4,097.95 the previous year. Margin ratios for the year-ending March 2025, show a Gross Profit Margin of 18.30%, Operating Margin of 17.00%, and Net Profit Margin of 12.49%. Return Ratios include a Return on Networth/Equity of 12.96%, a ROCE of 17.17%, and a Return on Assets of 9.34% for the same period. Liquidity Ratios for the year-ending March 2025, show a Current Ratio of 3.57 and a Quick Ratio of 3.41. Leverage Ratios indicate a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.00 and an Interest Coverage Ratio of 114.43. Growth ratios show a 3-year CAGR for Sales at 19.21% and a 3-year CAGR for Net Profit at 24.26% for the year-ending March 2025. Valuation ratios reveal a P/E ratio of 56.88, a P/B ratio of 7.33, an EV/EBITDA of 34.32 and a P/S ratio of 7.07 for the year-ending March 2025. Regarding corporate actions, the company announced a final dividend of Rs 105 per share on May 13, 2025, with the effect from June 16, 2025. This followed a dividend of Rs 100 per share announced on May 15, 2024. A Moneycontrol analysis from September 1, 2025, suggests a bullish outlook on the stock. With the stock last traded at Rs 36,130, Honeywell Automation has shown a positive movement in today's session.

title: Schaeffler India shares surge 1.38% amid high volume in today's session

On the financial front, the consolidated revenue for Schaeffler India for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,352.59 Crore, up from Rs 2,174.41 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 287.11 Crore, compared to Rs 251.62 Crore in the previous quarter. The EPS stood at Rs 18.40 in June 2025, increasing from Rs 16.10 in March 2025. title: Endurance Technologies shares rise 2.03% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Endurance Technologies are trading at Rs 3,028.00, up by 2.03% in Monday's session. title: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation shares rise 2.10% in morning trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation gained 2.10% in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 391.65. The stock is experiencing upward movement. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation is part of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation's financial performance shows a mix of results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 110,825.33 Crore, compared to Rs 109,632.80 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025 and Rs 113,888.28 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 4,222.21 Crore, up from Rs 3,066.59 Crore in the previous quarter and Rs 245.86 Crore in the same quarter last year. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 19.32, compared to Rs 16.06 in the previous quarter and Rs 2.98 in the same quarter of the previous year. The company's consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 434,106.17 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 433,856.51 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 6,855.29 Crore, down from Rs 14,206.63 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 31.66, compared to Rs 112.89 in the previous year. Key financial figures from the consolidated income statement include:ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 434,106 CroreRs 433,856 CroreRs 440,709 CroreRs 349,913 CroreRs 233,248 CroreOther IncomeRs 2,087 CroreRs 1,916 CroreRs 1,465 CroreRs 2,438 CroreRs 2,643 CroreTotal IncomeRs 436,194 CroreRs 435,773 CroreRs 442,175 CroreRs 352,352 CroreRs 235,892 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 423,709 CroreRs 414,525 CroreRs 452,476 CroreRs 343,669 CroreRs 220,870 CroreEBITRs 12,484 CroreRs 21,248 CroreRs -10,301 CroreRs 8,682 CroreRs 15,021 CroreInterestRs 3,365 CroreRs 2,556 CroreRs 2,174 CroreRs 997 CroreRs 963 CroreTaxRs 2,264 CroreRs 4,485 CroreRs -3,003 CroreRs 1,849 CroreRs 3,534 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,855 CroreRs 14,206 CroreRs -9,471 CroreRs 5,836 CroreRs 10,524 CroreThe company’s financial ratios indicate a P/E ratio of 11.38 and a P/B ratio of 1.50 as of March 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio stood at 1.30 for the year-ending March 2025. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation announced a final dividend of Rs 10.50 per share (105%) with an effective date of August 14, 2025. Additionally, the company had a bonus issue with an ex-bonus date of June 21, 2024, in the ratio of 1:2. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a bearish sentiment on the stock as of September 8, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 391.65, Hindustan Petroleum Corporation has seen a rise of 2.10% from its previous close.

title: Vedanta shares fall 3% as analysts flag Rs 17,000-cr Jaiprakash Associates offer as 'negative'
content: The shares of Vedanta dropped nearly 3 percent on September 8 after the company reportedly outbid the Adani Group with a Rs 17,000-crore offer for the assets of the bankrupt Jaiprakash Associates, which currently faces claims worth Rs 59,000 crore from various creditors. Vedanta's bid is higher than that of the Adani Group in the open challenge round, CNBC-TV18 reported citing people familiar with the matter. Other suitors in the fray include Dalmia Bharat Group, Jindal Power, and PNC Infratech, who have yet not submitted any bids in the final round, the report added. Moneycontrol couldn't independently verify the report. Nuvama said that it is a negative development for the minority shareholders of Vedanta, and the brokerage firm remains unconvinced by the group's rationale to acquire the assets, according to the brokerage note cited by CNBC-TV18. Vedanta is getting involved in an unrelated business when the group's priority should be deleveraging, Nuvama further stated, while adding that funding the Rs 17,000 crore itself would be difficult. “Culmination of the transaction is likely to restrict any re-rating for the stock," the Nuvama note cited by the business news channel said. Nuvama held its ‘Buy’ rating on the stock. ICICI Securities also noted that the development was unexpected as Jaiprakash Associates’ business portfolio does not align well with Vedanta's operations, according to the brokerage note cited by Business Standard. It added that most of JP’s businesses have been making losses for years, with some being entangled in legal disputes. This makes the outlook uncertain, it further said. Jaiprakash Power shares meanwhile jumped 5 percent to hit the upper circuit at Rs 20.02 apiece. The stock has so far gained nearly 8 percent in the past five days, and around 42 percent in the past six months. The stock currently has a P/E ratio of 17.59. Real estate and infrastructure firm Jaiprakash Associates (JAL) was admitted to Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) in 2024, after defaulting on payment of loans worth over Rs 57,000 crore. Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group, Anil Agarwal's Vedanta, Dalmia Bharat and several others had submitted their resolution plans to acquire JAL through the insolvency process. Jaypee Group's real estate holdings include high-profile projects such as the 452-acre Jaypee Greens township in Greater Noida, featuring luxury villas, apartments, and a golf course. Other assets include Jaypee Greens Wish Town Noida, a sprawling 1,063-acre township, and the Jaypee Greens Sports City, which boasts a motor racing track along the Yamuna Expressway. The resolution process for Jaypee Group involves a committee of creditors, including major financial institutions such as the State Bank of India (SBI), ICICI Bank and Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC). JAL owns 24 percent stake in Jaiprakash Power Ventures. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Newly-listed shares Vikram Solar, Anlon Healthcare, Vikran Engineering rise up to 10%; here's why
content: Shares of newly-listed companies Vikram Solar, Anlon Healthcare and Vikran Engineering gained up to 10 percent in Monday’s trade amid high volumes. Vikram Solar rose 9.73 percent to Rs 354.25 after the company secured an order from L&T Construction for the supply of 336 MW of high-efficiency solar modules to be deployed at Khavda in Gujarat. The modules, part of its Hypersol G12R series based on N-type technology, are designed to improve performance in high temperatures and reduce year-on-year degradation. Commenting on the development, Gyanesh Chaudhary, Chairman & Managing Director, Vikram Solar, said, "The region holds immense potential for solar energy, and this project will play a pivotal role in harnessing that opportunity. Each project we deliver is a testament to the trust placed in Vikram Solar’s technology, performance, and commitment to excellence." The stock was listed at Rs 338 on August 26, a premium of 1.81 percent over its issue price. The company had fixed the price band at Rs 315-332 per share and raised Rs 621 crore from anchor investors ahead of the issue. Vikram Solar shares list at 2% premium over IPO price on NSE Vikran Engineering gained 9.34 percent to Rs 103.78 on high volumes. The shares made their debut on September 3 at Rs 99 apiece, a little over 2 percent higher than the IPO price of Rs 97. Anlon Healthcare advanced 1 percent to Rs 93. The scrip was listed on September 3 at Rs 92 per share, about 1 percent higher than its issue price of Rs 91. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. title: Buy SRF; target of Rs 3540: Mirae Asset Sharekhan
content: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's research report on SRF SRF held a conference call to clarify on the quota regime for refrigerant gases. Companies will be allocated product wise or GWP based quotas, with quota calculations eventually to expressed in GWP terms. The company has given 20% revenue growth guidance for the chemical business. Specialty chemicals is expected to do well with traction in newly launched products and launch of AIs. In fluorochemicals, there is going to be good demand and pricing environment for ref gas. Outlook We maintain a Buy on SRF with a PT of Rs. 3,540, assigning a 37x multiple on its FY27 EPS. The stock is currently trading at 41x/30x its FY26/27 EPS. title: Infosys shares gain 0.76% in morning trade
content: Shares of Infosys were trading higher in Monday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,455.60. At 10:40 am, Infosys showed a gain of 0.76% from its previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 1,458.00 and a day's low of Rs 1,450.50. Infosys is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 26,750.00 Crore, a slight increase from the previous year's Rs 26,248.00 Crore. Quarterly Consolidated Financials:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreRs 42,279.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreRs 6,924.00 CroreEPS15.3815.7116.4316.9816.70The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 42,279.00 Crore, up from Rs 40,925.00 Crore in the previous quarter. Corporate Actions: Infosys announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) with an effective date of May 30, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share (420%) was announced on October 17, 2024, with an effective date of October 29, 2024. Bonus shares were last issued on July 13, 2018, in a 1:1 ratio. A stock split was announced on November 30, 1999, with an ex-split date of January 24, 2000, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5. Moneycontrol analysis gave a neutral sentiment on 2025-09-01. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 1,458.00 and a day's low of Rs 1,450.50.

title: Tata Motors, Tata Steel, JSW Steel stocks among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: At 10:30 am, Tata Motors was trading at Rs 710.50, a gain of 2.72%, while Tata Steel was at Rs 171.60, up 2.34%. JSW Steel was trading at Rs 1,093.60, up 1.91%. Hero Motocorp and Maruti Suzuki were also among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index. Tata Motors' revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 104,407.00 Crore, while net profit was Rs 3,871.00 Crore and EPS was Rs 10.66. In comparison, for the quarter-ending June 2024, revenue was Rs 108,048.00 Crore, net profit was Rs 5,563.00 Crore, and EPS was Rs 14.61. The consolidated yearly income statement shows sales of Rs 439,695 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 437,927 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 6,244 Crore and Rs 5,949 Crore for the respective years. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 22,991 Crore, compared to Rs 31,106 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Key financial figures from the consolidated balance sheet include share capital of Rs 3,200 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 115,407 Crore as of March 2025. Current liabilities were Rs 166,684 Crore, and total liabilities amounted to Rs 378,642 Crore. Fixed assets were valued at Rs 180,608 Crore, and total assets amounted to Rs 378,642 Crore. Tata Steel's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 53,178.12 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 1,927.64 Crore and an EPS of Rs 1.67. For the quarter-ending June 2024, revenue was Rs 54,771.39 Crore, net profit was Rs 826.06 Crore, and EPS was Rs 0.77. The consolidated yearly income statement shows sales of Rs 218,542 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 229,170 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 1,540 Crore and Rs 1,808 Crore for the respective years. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 2,982 Crore, while for the year-ending March 2024, the company incurred a loss of Rs 4,851 Crore. Key figures from the consolidated balance sheet include share capital of Rs 1,247 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 89,922 Crore as of March 2025. Current liabilities were Rs 86,093 Crore, and total liabilities amounted to Rs 279,394 Crore. Fixed assets were valued at Rs 186,577 Crore, and total assets amounted to Rs 279,394 Crore. JSW Steel's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 43,147.00 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 2,309.00 Crore and an EPS of Rs 8.95. In comparison, for the quarter-ending June 2024, revenue was Rs 42,943.00 Crore, net profit was Rs 879.00 Crore, and EPS was Rs 3.47. The consolidated yearly income statement shows sales of Rs 168,824 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 175,006 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 694 Crore and Rs 1,004 Crore for the respective years. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,802 Crore, compared to Rs 9,145 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Key figures from the consolidated balance sheet include share capital of Rs 369 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 79,191 Crore as of March 2025. Current liabilities were Rs 60,626 Crore, and total liabilities amounted to Rs 240,742 Crore. Fixed assets were valued at Rs 144,830 Crore, and total assets amounted to Rs 240,742 Crore. Hero Motocorp's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 9,727.75 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 1,076.21 Crore and an EPS of Rs 85.26. In comparison, for the quarter-ending June 2024, revenue was Rs 10,210.79 Crore, net profit was Rs 1,086.35 Crore, and EPS was Rs 52.31. The consolidated yearly income statement shows sales of Rs 40,923 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 37,788 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 1,044 Crore and Rs 854 Crore for the respective years. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 4,536 Crore, compared to Rs 3,862 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Key figures from the consolidated balance sheet include share capital of Rs 40 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 19,232 Crore as of March 2025. Current liabilities were Rs 7,475 Crore, and total liabilities amounted to Rs 28,390 Crore. Fixed assets were valued at Rs 6,770 Crore, and total assets amounted to Rs 28,390 Crore. Maruti Suzuki's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 38,605.20 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 3,756.90 Crore and an EPS of Rs 120.62. In comparison, for the quarter-ending June 2024, revenue was Rs 35,779.40 Crore, net profit was Rs 3,702.10 Crore, and EPS was Rs 119.58. The consolidated yearly income statement shows sales of Rs 152,913 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 141,858 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 5,022 Crore and Rs 4,093 Crore for the respective years. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 14,256 Crore, compared to Rs 13,234 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Key figures from the consolidated balance sheet include share capital of Rs 157 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 96,082 Crore as of March 2025. Current liabilities were Rs 30,570 Crore, and total liabilities amounted to Rs 131,971 Crore. Fixed assets were valued at Rs 40,911 Crore, and total assets amounted to Rs 131,971 Crore. Recent corporate announcements for Tata Motors include an intimation about a statement released by Jaguar Land Rover Automotive, Plc, UK, regarding an IT security incident. The company also released its monthly sales figures for August 2025. Tata Motors announced a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share, with an effective date of June 4, 2025. Tata Steel's recent announcements include the disclosure under regulations 30 and 51 of SEBI listing regulations and acquisition of equity stake in T Steel Holdings Pte. Ltd. Tata Steel announced a final dividend of Rs 3.60 per share, with an effective date of June 6, 2025. JSW Steel has announced incorporation of APJSW Private Limited, a Joint Venture Company to set up the Konijedu Marlapadu Integrated Iron Ore Project. JSW Steel announced a final dividend of Rs 2.80 per share, with an effective date of July 8, 2025. Hero Motocorp recently announced the appointment of Mr. Harshavasrdhan Chitale as the Chief Executive Officer of the Company effective January 5, 2026. Hero Motocorp announced a final dividend of Rs 65.00 per share, with an effective date of July 24, 2025. Maruti Suzuki recently launched the All-New VICTORIS, the SUV that's Got It All. The company also released its production volume for August 2025. Maruti Suzuki announced a final dividend of Rs 135.00 per share, with an effective date of August 1, 2025. According to Moneycontrol analysis as of September 1, 2025, the sentiment for these stocks is bullish. Tata Motors, Tata Steel, JSW Steel, Hero Motocorp and Maruti Suzuki were also among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index.

title: BSE Limited shares rise 2.03% in morning trade
content: Shares of BSE Limited saw a positive movement in Monday's session, with the stock currently trading at Rs 2,366.70. At 10:35 am, the stock showed a gain of 2.03% from its previous close; the stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. In terms of quarterly financial performance, the company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,037.45 Crore, compared to Rs 916.97 Crore in March 2025, Rs 831.74 Crore in December 2024, Rs 813.30 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 670.64 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same periods was Rs 521.88 Crore, Rs 478.04 Crore, Rs 198.73 Crore, Rs 321.40 Crore and Rs 241.56 Crore respectively. The EPS stood at Rs 13.09, Rs 36.00, Rs 16.00, Rs 25.25 and Rs 19.30 respectively. The yearly financial performance shows that the revenue for year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,212.04 Crore compared to Rs 1,592.50 Crore in March 2024, Rs 924.84 Crore in March 2023, Rs 743.15 Crore in March 2022 and Rs 501.37 Crore in March 2021. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,234.47 Crore, Rs 699.84 Crore, Rs 156.42 Crore, Rs 180.75 Crore and Rs 98.55 Crore respectively. The EPS stood at Rs 96.55, Rs 56.66, Rs 16.06, Rs 18.51 and Rs 30.94 respectively. The BVPS was Rs 326.84, Rs 255.24, Rs 208.86, Rs 206.26 and Rs 559.09 respectively. The ROE was 29.97, 23.57, 8.16, 9.58 and 5.81 respectively. The debt to equity was 0.00 for all the years.Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 3,212 CroreRs 1,592 CroreRs 924 CroreRs 743 CroreRs 501 CroreOther IncomeRs 24 CroreRs 25 CroreRs 29 CroreRs 120 CroreRs 153 CroreTotal IncomeRs 3,236 CroreRs 1,617 CroreRs 953 CroreRs 863 CroreRs 654 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 1,570 CroreRs 679 CroreRs 678 CroreRs 578 CroreRs 534 CroreEBITRs 1,665 CroreRs 938 CroreRs 275 CroreRs 285 CroreRs 119 CroreInterestRs 0 CroreRs 15 CroreRs 27 CroreRs 22 CroreRs 10 CroreTaxRs 431 CroreRs 223 CroreRs 91 CroreRs 82 CroreRs 10 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,234 CroreRs 699 CroreRs 156 CroreRs 180 CroreRs 98 CroreThe company announced a bonus issue on March 30, 2025, with a ratio of 2:1 and a record date of May 23, 2025. The ex-bonus date is the same as the record date. Prior to this, a bonus issue was announced on February 8, 2022, also with a 2:1 ratio. The record date was March 22, 2022, and the ex-bonus date was March 21, 2022. The company has announced dividends with key dates. On May 6, 2025, a final dividend of Rs 18 per share was recommended, with an effective date of May 14, 2025. Additionally, on May 7, 2025, a special dividend of Rs 5 was recommended to commemorate the 150th year of BSE Ltd, also with an effective date of May 14, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 2,366.70, BSE Limited has seen a rise of 2.03% in today's session.

title: Hero Motocorp shares rise 2.37% in morning trade
content: Shares of Hero Motocorp gained 2.37% to trade at Rs 5,490 on Monday, as of 10:34 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. On September 8, 2025, Hero MotoCorp Limited announced the appointment of Mr. Harshavasrdhan Chitale as the Chief Executive Officer of the Company, effective January 5, 2026. Financial Performance: The consolidated revenue for Hero Motocorp for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 9,727.75 Crore, compared to Rs 10,210.79 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 1,076.21 Crore, while in June 2024, the net profit was Rs 1,086.35 Crore. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 85.26, compared to Rs 52.31 in June 2024. The company's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 40,923.42 Crore, compared to Rs 37,788.62 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 4,536.93 Crore, up from Rs 3,862.41 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased to Rs 218.96 for the year-ending March 2025, from Rs 187.36 in March 2024. Here is a more detailed look at Hero Motocorp's key financial figures:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)202130,959.192,982.61146.07202229,551.282,528.10115.96202334,158.382,796.79140.62202437,788.623,862.41187.36202540,923.424,536.93218.96The revenue increased by 8.30% in 2025 compared to 2024. The net profit also decreased by 0.93% during the same period. However, the EPS increased significantly by 63% from June 2024 to June 2025. Balance Sheet: As of March 2025, Hero Motocorp had a share capital of Rs 40 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 19,232 Crore. The current liabilities stood at Rs 7,475 Crore, and other liabilities were Rs 1,642 Crore, resulting in total liabilities of Rs 28,390 Crore. The fixed assets were valued at Rs 6,770 Crore, current assets at Rs 13,433 Crore, and other assets at Rs 8,186 Crore, with total assets matching the total liabilities at Rs 28,390 Crore. The contingent liabilities were Rs 2,031 Crore. Cash Flow: The net cash flow for Hero Motocorp as of March 2025 was -Rs 221 Crore. On May 13, 2025, a final dividend of Rs 65 per share (3250%) was announced, effective July 24, 2025. Prior to that, on February 6, 2025, an interim dividend of Rs 100 per share (5000%) was announced, effective February 12, 2025. As of September 8, 2025, a Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock.

title: Tata Motors, M&M, other auto stocks rise up to 6% amid price cuts by some automakers, BofA upgrades
content: Auto stocks surged on September 8 after some automakers announced strong price cuts after the GST Council decided to reduced taxes on several vehicles. The sharp rise in the share prices pushed the Nifty Auto index up around 2.5 percent in morning trade. The auto index rose to 26,977, emerging as the top sectoral gainer on the stock market today. Bharat Forge and Ashok Leyland shares lead the gains, rising around 6 percent and over 4 percent respectively. Bank of America (BofA) has increased the target prices of several auto stocks, anticipating sharp upside potential after the latest GST cuts. Tata Motors shares jumped nearly 3 percent to trade at Rs 712 apiece. The company on September 5 said that it will pass on the full benefits of the recent GST rate reduction to customers across its cars and SUVs, with price cuts of up to Rs 1.55 lakh effective September 22. Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) shares jumped more than 3 percent to trade at Rs 3,672 apiece. The company also had announced that it will fully pass on the GST 2.0 benefits to customers across its ICE SUV portfolio with immediate effect. As a reduction in GST, M&M's popular models like the Thar, Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700, and Scorpio-N will now be available with substantial savings ranging from Rs 1.01 lakh to Rs 1.56 lakh, depending on the model and variant. BofA increased its target price for M&M to Rs 4,000 per share, from Rs 3,750 per share, while keeping its 'Buy' rating on the stock, according to the brokerage note cited by NDTV Profit. The latest target price implies an upside potential of more than 12 percent over the stock's previous closing price of Rs 3,561.30 per share. Samvardhana Motherson shares gained nearly 4 percent, while Bajaj Auto, Hero Moto Corp and TVS Motors shares were up around 3 percent. For the two-wheeler makers too, BofA has increased the target prices, while remaining 'Neutral'. For Bajaj Auto, the international brokerage increased the target price to Rs 9,600 apiece, while for TVS Motors, it increased the target price to Rs 3,725 apiece, according to the brokerage note cited by NDTV Profit. Hero MotoCorp's price target was increased to Rs 5,650 apiece. Maruti Suzuki shares gained nearly 1.6 percent. While the company has not announced price cuts yet, its Chairman RC Bhargava in an interview with Financial Express hinted at strong reduction in car prices. He told the publication that the price of Alto could drop by Rs 45,000, while the WagonR may see price cuts between Rs 60,000 and Rs 70,000. BofA has increased the target price for the stock to Rs 17,000 per share, from Rs 14,000 per share, and has maintained its 'Buy' rating on the stock, according to the brokerage note cited by NDTV Profit. ICICI Securities has a 'Buy' call on Maruti Suzuki, and increased its target price to Rs 17,000 per share. This implies an upside potential of more than 14 percent from the stock's previous closing price of Rs 14,895 per share. "The recent reduction in GST rates from 28% to 18% across most segments in the auto sector may inject fresh demand momentum. This is in addition to the recent rationalisation of personal income tax slabs, interest rate cuts and the upcoming Pay Commission revisions. These factors are expected to increase affordability and stimulate demand, addressing the industry's challenges of muted sales, especially in the entry level segment," the domestic brokerage said. Eicher Motors shares meanwhile were trading more than 2 percent higher. BofA has increased its target price for the stock to Rs 7,500 apiece, implying an upside potential of nearly 14 percent from the stock's previous closing price. Hyundai Motor India, which is not a part of the Nifty Auto index, rose nearly 2 percent. Bosch and Balkrishna Industries shares were up more than 1 percent each. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Adani Power shares rise 2.31% in Monday's trading session
content: Adani Power shares are trading at Rs 623.80, up by 2.31% in Monday's session at 10:23 am. Adani Power is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark NIFTY NEXT 50 index. The company has demonstrated substantial financial growth over the past few years. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 56,203.09 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 50,351.25 Crore in the previous year and Rs 38,773.30 Crore in 2023. Net profit for the same period was Rs 12,749.61 Crore, although it decreased from Rs 20,828.79 Crore in March 2024. Key financial ratios reflect this performance. The basic and diluted EPS for March 2025 were both Rs 32.32, compared to Rs 51.62 in the previous year. The book value per share (excluding revaluation reserve) increased to Rs 138.17 in March 2025 from Rs 92.26 in March 2024. The company’s debt-to-equity ratio stood at 0.71 as of March 2025, down from 0.96 the previous year. title: Swiggy shares rise 3.14% in morning trade; stock among top gainers on Nifty Next 50

title: JSW Steel shares rise 2.88% in morning trade
content: Shares of JSW Steel gained 2.88% to trade at Rs 1,104.00 in Monday's session. This increase positions the stock among the gainers on the Nifty 50 index. Taking a look at the financial performance of JSW Steel, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 43,147 Crore, up from Rs 42,943 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,309 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 879 Crore reported for the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS also saw a substantial increase, rising to Rs 8.95 in June 2025 from Rs 3.47 in June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue shows a fluctuating trend. For the year 2025, the revenue was Rs 168,824 Crore, down from Rs 175,006 Crore in 2024. The net profit for 2025 was Rs 3,802 Crore, a decrease from Rs 9,145 Crore in 2024. The EPS also decreased from Rs 36.34 in 2024 to Rs 14.36 in 2025. title: Steel Authority of India shares rise 3.09% in morning trade
content: Steel Authority of India (SAIL) shares demonstrated positive momentum in Monday's trading session, with the stock price increasing by 3.09% to Rs 133.25. This rise positions SAIL among the gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index as of 10:20 am. Regarding the company's financial performance, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 25,921.76 Crore, compared to Rs 23,997.81 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 671.48 Crore, a notable increase from a net loss of Rs 24.87 Crore in June 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 0.20 to Rs 1.80. On an annual basis, the consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 102,479.06 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 105,378.33 Crore reported for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit decreased from Rs 2,628.06 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 1,885.02 Crore in March 2025. The EPS decreased from Rs 7.42 to Rs 5.74 during the same period. title: TVS Motor shares hit 52-week high of Rs 3,515 on NSE
content: TVS Motor Company shares reached a 52-week high of Rs 3,515.00 on the NSE at 10:16 am on Monday. The stock is currently trading at Rs 3,476.60 and is a part of the Nifty Next 50 index. title: Top losers on Nifty 50 today: SBI Life Insurance, Asian Paints stocks drag on benchmark index in morning trade
content: During Monday's trading session, several stocks were among the top losers on the Nifty 50. At 10:00 am, SBI Life Insurance stock was trading at Rs 1,775.70, a decrease of 1.64% this hour. Asian Paints traded at Rs 2,552.90, down by 1.05% this hour. Dr Reddys Labs was at Rs 1,259.40, falling by 0.69% this hour. Trent's shares were priced at Rs 5,499.50, down by 0.52% this hour, while Titan Company was at Rs 3,647.20, a decline of 0.49% this hour.SBI Life Insurance Key RatiosKey financial ratios for SBI Life Insurance include a basic EPS of Rs 24.09 and a diluted EPS of Rs 24.07 as of March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 169.49, and the dividend per share was Rs 2.70. The face value of the shares is Rs 10. Margin ratios include a gross profit margin of 2.60%, an operating margin of 2.53%, and a net profit margin of 2.06%. Return ratios show a return on net worth/equity of 14.20%, ROCE of 0.65%, and return on assets of 0.52%. Liquidity ratios indicate a current ratio of 1.39 and a quick ratio of 1.39. Leverage ratios show a debt to equity ratio of 0.00 and an interest coverage ratio of 265.96.SBI Life Insurance Corporate ActionsCorporate actions announced by SBI Life Insurance include updates regarding Next-Generation GST Reforms (Exemption Of GST On Individual Life Insurance Policies) as of September 4, 2025. Additionally, the Shareholder Meeting / Postal Ballot-Scrutinizer's Report was released on August 29, 2025.Asian Paints Financial OverviewAsian Paints reported consolidated annual sales of Rs 33,905 Crore for the year ending March 2025, a decrease of 4.47% compared to Rs 35,494 Crore in the previous year. The company's consolidated net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 3,569 Crore, compared to Rs 5,424 Crore in the previous year. title: Ashok Leyland hits all-time high of Rs 135.40 on BSE
content: Ashok Leyland shares reached an all-time high of Rs 135.40 on the BSE in Monday's session. At 10:10 am, the stock was trading at Rs 130.77 on BSE. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Regarding the company's financial performance, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 11,708.54 Crore, compared to Rs 10,724.49 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 652.98 Crore, while in the quarter-ending June 2024, the net profit was Rs 549.53 Crore. The EPS stood at Rs 1.04 for the quarter-ending June 2025, down from Rs 1.73 in the quarter-ending June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 45,790.64 Crore in 2024 to Rs 48,535.14 Crore in 2025. The net profit also saw an increase, from Rs 2,679.96 Crore in 2024 to Rs 3,351.21 Crore in 2025. The EPS increased from Rs 8.46 in 2024 to Rs 10.58 in 2025. Here is a detailed look at Ashok Leyland's financial performance:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 202119,454.10-69.10-0.56Mar 202226,237.15-292.97-1.22Mar 202341,672.601,350.914.23Mar 202445,790.642,679.968.46Mar 202548,535.143,351.2110.58The company's revenue has shown consistent growth over the past five years. Revenue increased by 63.13% from Rs 26,237.15 Crore in March 2022 to Rs 41,672.60 Crore in March 2023. The net profit has also significantly improved, transitioning from losses in 2021 and 2022 to substantial profits in the subsequent years.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202410,724.49549.531.73Sep 202411,147.58755.212.40Dec 202411,995.21812.092.59Mar 202514,695.551,234.383.85Jun 202511,708.54652.981.04Quarterly revenues have generally increased over the last five quarters, with a notable peak in March 2025. Net profit and EPS have fluctuated, showing strong performance in the quarter-ending March 2025 but decreasing in the quarter-ending June 2025. Ashok Leyland announced a bonus issue with a bonus ratio of 1:1, with the ex-bonus date being July 16, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 4.25 per share (425%) was announced on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of May 22, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of September 2, 2025. Ashok Leyland has hit an all time high of Rs 135.40 on BSE.

title: Samvardhana Motherson International shares rise 2.03%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Samvardhana Motherson International gained 2.03% to trade at Rs 96.52 in Monday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Next 50 index at 10:03 am. On the financial front, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 30,212 Crore, up from Rs 29,316.83 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 481.82 Crore, down from Rs 983.33 Crore in the previous quarter. The company's consolidated yearly revenue has shown consistent growth. In the year-ending March 2025, the revenue reached Rs 113,662.60 Crore, compared to Rs 98,691.70 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,618.20 Crore, an increase from Rs 2,782.00 Crore in the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 4.01 in March 2024 to Rs 5.50 in March 2025. title: Prestige Estates Projects shares rise 2.01% in morning trade
content: Shares of Prestige Estates Projects gained 2.01% to trade at Rs 1,540.80 in Monday's session. At 10:01 am, the stock saw positive movement compared to its previous close. Prestige Estates Projects is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. In corporate action, the company announced intimation in relation to receipt of Show Cause Notice by subsidiary of the Company on September 3, 2025. The company announced issuance of corporate guarantee to wholly owned subsidiary on September 1, 2025. The company had announced Intimation regarding 100 Days Campaign Titled "Saksham Niveshak" on August 21, 2025. Prestige Estates Projects announced a final dividend of Rs 1.80 per share (18%) on May 30, 2025, with an effective date of September 3, 2025. Earlier dividends include Rs 1.80 per share (18%) announced on May 29, 2024, with an effective date of September 23, 2024, and Rs 1.50 per share (15%) announced on May 30, 2023, with an effective date of September 14, 2023. Financial Performance: A look at the financial performance of Prestige Estates Projects: Consolidated Yearly Figures: The company's consolidated yearly revenue has fluctuated over the past five years. In March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 7,349.40 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 7,877.10 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for March 2025 was Rs 659.90 Crore, significantly lower than the Rs 1,617.40 Crore reported in March 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) also decreased from Rs 34.28 in March 2024 to Rs 11.19 in March 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased to Rs 358.09 in March 2025 from Rs 281.59 in March 2024. The return on equity (ROE) saw a decrease, standing at 3.03% in March 2025 compared to 12.17% in March 2024. The debt-to-equity ratio decreased to 0.69 in March 2025 from 1.02 in March 2024.HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 7,349.40 CroreRs 7,877.10 CroreRs 8,315.00 CroreRs 6,389.50 CroreRs 7,264.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 659.90 CroreRs 1,617.40 CroreRs 1,050.00 CroreRs 1,231.30 CroreRs 1,577.10 CroreEPS11.1934.2823.4928.6936.32BVPS358.09281.59255.89238.14176.98ROE3.0312.179.4412.6421.81Debt to Equity0.691.020.810.720.54Consolidated Quarterly Figures: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 2,307.30 Crore, compared to Rs 1,862.10 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 328.00 Crore, while it was Rs 319.80 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024. The EPS increased from Rs 5.80 in June 2024 to Rs 6.79 in June 2025.HeadingJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024RevenueRs 2,307.30 CroreRs 1,528.40 CroreRs 1,654.50 CroreRs 2,304.40 CroreRs 1,862.10 CroreNet ProfitRs 328.00 CroreRs 55.20 CroreRs 39.20 CroreRs 245.70 CroreRs 319.80 CroreEPS6.790.580.414.705.80The cash flow from operating activities for March 2025 was Rs 130 Crore, compared to Rs 1,297 Crore for March 2024. As per the balance sheet, the total liabilities for March 2025 were Rs 58,795 Crore, while the total assets were Rs 58,795 Crore. Key financial ratios for Prestige Estates Projects show a P/E ratio of 105.84 and a P/B ratio of 3.31 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.69 as of the year-ending March 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment on the stock as of September 1, 2025. In Monday's session, shares of Prestige Estates Projects were trading at Rs 1,540.80, marking a 2.01% increase.

title: Tata Motors shares rise 2.03% in early trade
content: Tata Motors' stock experienced a 2.03% increase, reaching Rs 705.75 in Monday's early trading session. At 9:18 am, the stock showed positive movement, reflecting an optimistic start for the automaker. This rise places the stock among the gainers. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Tata Motors' financial performance shows consistent revenue generation. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 104,407 Crore, compared to Rs 119,503 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Net profit for the same period was Rs 3,871 Crore and Rs 8,442 Crore, respectively. The EPS stood at Rs 10.66 for June 2025, against Rs 23.40 for March 2025. Here's a summary of Tata Motors' quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 108,048.00 CroreRs 101,450.00 CroreRs 113,575.00 CroreRs 119,503.00 CroreRs 104,407.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,563.00 CroreRs 3,368.00 CroreRs 5,616.00 CroreRs 8,442.00 CroreRs 3,871.00 CroreEPS14.619.7214.8123.4010.66The company's annual financial data indicates a strong growth trajectory over the years. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 439,695.00 Crore, compared to Rs 437,927.77 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Net profit stood at Rs 22,991.00 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, against Rs 31,106.95 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. EPS was Rs 78.80 and Rs 81.95 for the respective years. Here's an overview of Tata Motors' yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 249,794.75 CroreRs 278,453.62 CroreRs 345,966.96 CroreRs 437,927.77 CroreRs 439,695.00 CroreNet ProfitRs -13,016.14 CroreRs -11,234.70 CroreRs 2,353.49 CroreRs 31,106.95 CroreRs 22,991.00 CroreEPS-36.99-29.886.2981.9578.80BVPS148.39127.50137.33242.90315.61ROE-24.34-25.675.3236.9723.96Debt to Equity2.083.132.771.160.54Tata Motors has announced several corporate actions, including analyst/investor meetings and press releases regarding monthly sales. The company announced a virtual group meeting of analysts/institutional investors scheduled for September 12, 2025, at 6:30 p.m. (IST). Additionally, the company released a press release titled ''Tata Motors Monthly Sales - August 2025'' on September 1, 2025. The company has a history of dividend payouts, with the latest final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share (300%) announced on May 13, 2025, and effective from June 4, 2025. Tata Motors has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue on September 28, 1995, in the ratio of 3:5. Earlier on May 26, 2011, Tata Motors split its shares, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 2; the effective date for the split was September 12, 2011. With the stock currently trading at Rs 705.75, Tata Motors shows a positive start in today's session, reflecting overall bullish sentiment from Moneycontrol analysis as of September 1, 2025.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade flat in early session
content: Larsen & Toubro shares were trading at Rs 3,553.40 in Monday's session, a marginal decline of 0.01% from the previous close, as of 9:30 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. title: JSW Steel stock hits all-time high of Rs 1,111.20 on BSE
content: JSW Steel reached an all-time high of Rs 1,111.20 on the BSE in early trade Monday. At 9:20 am, the stock was trading at Rs 1,073.10. Financial Snapshot The financial performance of JSW Steel reveals the following: Consolidated Quarterly Results: Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 43,147 Crore, up from Rs 42,943 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 2,309 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 879 Crore reported in June 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 3.47 in June 2024 to Rs 8.95 in June 2025. Consolidated Yearly Results: The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 168,824 Crore, slightly lower compared to Rs 175,006 Crore in March 2024. Net profit decreased to Rs 3,802 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 9,145 Crore in March 2024. Consequently, the EPS also declined from Rs 36.34 in March 2024 to Rs 14.36 in March 2025. Key financial ratios include a book value per share (BVPS) of Rs 260.64 and a return on equity (ROE) of 4.40% as of March 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio stood at 1.21 for the year-ending March 2025.Financials (Consolidated Yearly)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 168,824 CroreRs 175,006 CroreRs 165,960 CroreRs 146,371 CroreRs 79,839 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,802 CroreRs 9,145 CroreRs 4,276 CroreRs 20,021 CroreRs 7,872 CroreEPS14.3636.3417.2585.9632.91BVPS260.64261.56222.72227.69152.80ROE4.4011.346.3030.7016.91Debt to Equity1.211.101.201.041.11The annual sales for March 2025 stood at Rs 168,824 Crore, compared to Rs 175,006 Crore for March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 694 Crore for March 2025 against Rs 1,004 Crore for March 2024. The total expenditure was Rs 155,718 Crore for March 2025 against Rs 154,353 Crore for March 2024. EBIT was Rs 13,800 Crore and Rs 21,657 Crore for March 2025 and March 2024 respectively. Corporate Actions JSW Steel has announced several corporate actions. On September 4, 2025, the company released a newspaper advertisement regarding the initiation of the "Saksham Niveshak" campaign by IEPFA. On August 26, 2025, APJSW Private Limited, a joint venture company for the Konijedu Marlapadu Integrated Iron Ore Project, was incorporated. Additionally, a schedule for meetings with analysts and institutional investors was announced on August 25, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.80 per share (280%) on May 23, 2025, with an effective date of July 8, 2025. JSW Steel is part of the Nifty 50 index.

The company announced disclosures under Reg. 29(2) of SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011 on September 04, 2025. The company also announced disclosures under Reg. 31(1) and 31(2) of SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011 on September 02, 2025. Additionally, there was an announcement under Regulation 30 (LODR)-Scheme of Arrangement on August 29, 2025. Vedanta has announced multiple dividends. There was also a bonus issue on March 30, 1993 (ex-bonus date April 23, 1993) and August 29, 1986 (ratio 2:5). The company had a rights issue on August 11, 1995, with a ratio of 1:10 and an ex-rights date of August 14, 1995. Vedanta had a stock split on April 28, 2008, with an ex-split date of August 08, 2008. Moneycontrol analysis indicates neutral sentiment on the stock as of September 03, 2025. In summary, Vedanta's stock experienced a decline in early trade, influenced by overall market dynamics, and is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index.

title: Mahindra and Mahindra shares hit 52-week high on BSE
content: Mahindra and Mahindra stock touched a 52-week high of Rs 3,619.80 on the BSE in early trade. At 9:16 am, the stock was trading at Rs 3,561.30 on the BSE. Quarterly Financial Highlights: A look at the company's consolidated quarterly financials shows consistent growth. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 45,529.19 Crore, up from Rs 37,217.72 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 3,898.44 Crore, compared to Rs 3,221.34 Crore in the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 29.44 to Rs 36.58. The previous quarters also showed strong performance, with revenue reaching Rs 42,599.31 Crore in March 2025 and Rs 41,470.05 Crore in December 2024. Net profit figures were Rs 3,102.48 Crore and Rs 3,317.22 Crore for March and December 2024, respectively. Annual Financial Highlights: The consolidated annual financials reveal a steady upward trend. Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 158,749.75 Crore, a substantial increase from Rs 74,277.78 Crore in 2021. Net profit also grew significantly, from Rs 2,425.26 Crore in 2021 to Rs 12,535.75 Crore in 2025. The EPS has seen a corresponding rise from Rs 16.33 in 2021 to Rs 115.91 in 2025. Key financial data is presented in the table below:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 74,277.00 CroreRs 90,170.00 CroreRs 121,268.00 CroreRs 138,279.00 CroreRs 158,749.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,425.00 CroreRs 5,397.00 CroreRs 9,869.00 CroreRs 11,148.00 CroreRs 12,535.00 CroreEPSRs 16.33Rs 59.20Rs 92.41Rs 101.14Rs 115.91BVPSRs 456.20Rs 510.96Rs 602.37Rs 695.30Rs 690.13ROE4.3513.9518.2417.0216.78Debt to Equity1.431.581.571.561.57The revenue has increased by approximately 14.73 percent in 2025 compared to 2024, net profit increased by 12.44 percent in 2025 compared to 2024, and EPS also increased from 101.14 to 115.91. Cash Flow: The cash flow statement indicates the following (all figures in Crore):Cash flow from operating activities: Rs 3,175 in March 2025 compared to Rs -5,629 in March 2024.Cash flow from investing activities: Rs -18,626 in March 2025 compared to Rs -5,597 in March 2024.Cash flow from financing activities: Rs 15,834 in March 2025 compared to Rs 12,281 in March 2024.Net cash flow: Rs 393 in March 2025 compared to Rs 1,036 in March 2024.Balance Sheet: Key figures from the consolidated balance sheet (all figures in Crore):Share capital: Rs 558 in March 2025 compared to Rs 557 in March 2024.Reserves & surplus: Rs 76,480 in March 2025 compared to Rs 65,334 in March 2024.Total Liabilities: Rs 277,586 in March 2025 compared to Rs 236,300 in March 2024.Total Assets: Rs 277,586 in March 2025 compared to Rs 236,300 in March 2024.Financial Ratios: Mahindra and Mahindra showed a basic EPS of Rs 115.91 and a diluted EPS of Rs 115.06 for March 2025. The book value per share stood at Rs 690.13. The company's dividend per share was Rs 25.30. Margin ratios include a gross profit margin of 20.59%, an operating margin of 16.77%, and a net profit margin of 7.89%. Return ratios show a return on net worth/equity of 16.78%, a ROCE of 14.21%, and a return on assets of 4.65%. Liquidity ratios include a current ratio of 1.40 and a quick ratio of 1.18. Leverage ratios show a debt to equity ratio of 1.57 and an interest coverage ratio of 3.60. Corporate Actions: The company has been actively engaging with analysts and investors, participating in the Ashwamedh - Elara India Dialogue and the Motilal Oswal 21st Annual Global Investor Conference in Mumbai. Presentations shared during these events are available on the company's website. In other corporate developments, there was an announcement regarding the dilution of stake in Mahindra Last Mile Mobility Limited. The company has announced a final dividend of Rs 25.30 per share, or 506%, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Other dividend announcements are also available, with the latest being on May 5, 2025. Mahindra and Mahindra issued bonus shares on multiple occasions, including a 1:1 bonus on November 10, 2017, and June 14, 2005. It also had bonus issues on November 7, 1995, April 29, 1984, and April 29, 1980. The company had a rights issue announced on September 30, 1992, with a ratio of 1:5. Mahindra and Mahindra split its stock on January 25, 2010, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5. Moneycontrol's analysis as of September 1, 2025, indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,561.30, Mahindra and Mahindra has seen a strong performance, marked by a new 52-week high on the BSE.

title: Tata Steel shares rise 2.21% in early trade
content: Tata Steel shares gained 2.21% in early trade, with the stock price reaching Rs 171.39. At 9:17 am, Tata Steel was trading positively. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Tata Steel's financial performance shows a mix of quarterly and yearly results. Consolidated quarterly revenue figures show Rs 53,178.12 Crore for June 2025, compared to Rs 56,218.11 Crore for March 2025, Rs 53,648.30 Crore for December 2024, Rs 53,904.71 Crore for September 2024, and Rs 54,771.39 Crore for June 2024. The net profit for June 2025 stood at Rs 1,927.64 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 1,124.08 Crore reported in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) also increased to Rs 1.67 in June 2025, compared to Rs 1.04 in March 2025. The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 54,771.39 CroreRs 53,904.71 CroreRs 53,648.30 CroreRs 56,218.11 CroreRs 53,178.12 CroreNet ProfitRs 826.06 CroreRs 784.32 CroreRs 248.51 CroreRs 1,124.08 CroreRs 1,927.64 CroreEPS0.770.670.261.041.67Consolidated yearly revenue figures show Rs 218,542.51 Crore for 2025, compared to Rs 229,170.78 Crore for 2024, Rs 243,352.69 Crore for 2023, Rs 243,959.17 Crore for 2022 and Rs 156,477.40 Crore for 2021. The net profit for 2025 stood at Rs 2,982.97 Crore, which is up compared to net loss of Rs -4,851.63 Crore in 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) is at Rs 2.74 in 2025, compared to loss per share of Rs -3.62 in 2024. The following table summarizes the consolidated yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 156,477.40 CroreRs 243,959.17 CroreRs 243,352.69 CroreRs 229,170.78 CroreRs 218,542.51 CroreNet ProfitRs 7,862.45 CroreRs 41,100.16 CroreRs 7,657.23 CroreRs -4,851.63 CroreRs 2,982.97 CroreEPS63.78332.357.17-3.622.74BVPS640.69958.8786.1274.1073.09ROE10.1935.088.49-4.823.75Debt to Equity1.100.600.760.890.98Tata Steel announced a final dividend of Rs 3.60 per share on May 12, 2025, with an effective date of June 6, 2025. Other corporate actions include bonus issues and stock splits. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 171.39, Tata Steel has shown a positive movement in early trade.

title: Ajanta Pharma shares fall 1.3%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 in early trade
content: Shares of Ajanta Pharma were trading down by 1.3% at Rs 2,580.00 in early trade on Monday, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Other stocks that saw losses include Sundaram Fin, New India Assur, Endurance Techn and Supreme Ind. Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,144.92 CroreRs 1,186.64 CroreRs 1,146.13 CroreRs 1,170.41 CroreRs 1,302.65 CroreNet ProfitRs 245.77 CroreRs 216.48 CroreRs 232.88 CroreRs 225.26 CroreRs 255.34 CroreEPS19.5417.2718.6018.0020.44 Ajanta Pharma's revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,302.65 Crore, compared to Rs 1,144.92 Crore in June 2024, marking an increase. title: Deepak Nitrite shares hit 52-week low on BSE
content: Deepak Nitrite shares touched a 52-week low of Rs 1,745.00 on the BSE on Monday. At 09:24 am, the stock was trading at Rs 1,746.70, a decline of 0.16% from the previous close. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Deepak Nitrite's consolidated financial performance shows varied trends. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,889.88 Crore, compared to Rs 2,166.84 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 112.25 Crore, down from Rs 202.53 Crore in the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 8.23 in June 2025, compared to Rs 14.85 in June 2024. The annual consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 8,281.93 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 7,681.83 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 697.37 Crore, lower than the Rs 810.86 Crore recorded in March 2024. The EPS decreased to Rs 51.12 in March 2025, from Rs 59.45 in March 2024. At 09:30 am, Tata Steel was trading at Rs 171.59, a 2.33% increase from its previous close. Concurrently, Tata Motors' shares were priced at Rs 704.50, reflecting a 1.85% rise from the previous day's closing value. title: Prime Focus shares up 10 percent as Ramesh Damani, Madhu Kela's AMC, Utpal Sheth, others acquire 3.3 percent stake
content: Shares of media and entertainment company Prime Focus are sharply higher by 10 percent on September 8 after marquee investors including Ramesh Damani, Madhu Kela-owned Singularity AMC, Utpal Sheth, and others acquired a stake 3.3 percent stake in the company Rs 146.2 crore. Singularity Large Value Fund I, II, and III - owned by Madhusudan Kela and son Yash Kela - have acquired 62.5 lakh shares (two percent stake) at Rs 142.55 per share. At the same price, Ramesh Damani too has picked up 8 lakh shares, while Utpal Sheth has bought 17.5 lakh shares. In addition, FE Securities and Samyak Enterprises each have purchased 14.55 lakh shares. Two major funds exited in the block deal, with Singapore-based Marina IV fund selling 48.06 lakh shares or 1.55 percent stakewhile Augusta Investments I fund sold 54.48 lakh shares which is 1.75 percent stake. Buyers Ramesh Damani, Utpal Sheth and Madhusudan Kela's AMC did not have exposure to Prime Focus, according to the June shareholding data shared by the company. On September 8, the shares have clocked a combined volume of over one crore shares which is 4x the one-month average. Prime Focus shares had rallied on Friday as well, hitting the 10 percent upper circuit. In the last one week, the shares of Prime Focus are higher by 23 percent, and up 50 percent over last three months. Prime Focus has projected that India's Media and Entertainment sector is expected to grow by 7.2 percent to reach Rs 2.68 trillion by 2025, and then grow at 7 percent CAGR to reach Rs 3.07 trillion by 2027. New media will provide 68 percent of this growth. By 2030, Prime Focus sees large screens in India crossing 20 crore mark, and small (phone) screens reaching almost 70 crore, which the company said will create a large base of consumers for content and information. Prime Focus said in its latest annual report that it sees global projects to rebound in 2025 and the animation and VFX segment is slated to recover sharply in 2025 and 2026. During FY25, Prime Focus' income from operations fell to Rs 3,599 crore due to macroeconomic and industry challenges. The adjusted EBITDA increases from Rs 479 crore to Rs 1,027 crore in FY25 and the adjusted EBITDA margin rose to 28.5 percent in FY25 from 12.1 percent a year ago.

title: Zydus Lifescience shares fall post four observations from USFDA
content: Zydus Lifescience share price fell in the early trade on September 8 following the US regulator issued four observations to the company's Vadodara unit. At 09:25am, Zydus Lifesciences was quoting at Rs 1,009.60, down Rs 4.55, or 0.45 percent, on the BSE. The United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) conducted an inspection at the group’s injectable manufacturing plant at Jarod, near Vadodara, Gujarat. The US regulator issued four observations post completing inspection from August 25, to September 5, 2025, company said. There were no data integrity related observations and will closely work with the USFDA to address the observations expeditiously, it added. Catch all the market action on our live blog Last week, company's wholly owned subsidiary, Zydus Lifesciences Global FZE, entered into an exclusive licensing and supply agreement with Synthon BV of the Netherlands for Ozanimod Capsules (a generic version of ZEPOSIA) for the US market. Synthon has a pending abbreviated new drug application in the United States, seeking approval for Ozanimod Capsules indicated for relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis. Also, announced the launch of its trivalent influenza (Flu) vaccine VaxiFluTM introduced for the first time in India, aligning with the global recommendations of WHO. The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 1,135.95 and a 52-week low of Rs 797.05 on 16 September, 2024 and 07 April, 2025, respectively. Currently, the stock is trading 11.12 percent below its 52-week high and 26.67 percent above its 52-week low. The market capitalisation of the company stands at Rs 101,589.38 crore.

title: Aurobindo Pharma shares fall on eight observations from USFDA
content: Aurobindo Pharma share price declined in the opening trade on September 8 following the company received eight observations from the United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA). At 09:25am, Aurobindo Pharma was quoting at Rs 1,036.60, down Rs 7.80, or 0.75 percent, on the BSE. The USFDA inspected company's Unit-XII, including oral solids and injectable manufacturing unit, situated at Bachupally, Medchal Malkajgiri District, Telangana from August 25 to September 05, 2025. At the end of the current inspection, a ‘Form 483’ was issued with a total of 8 observations for both (oral solids & injectable). All observations are procedural in nature and will respond to the US FDA within the stipulated timelines, company said. Catch all the market action on our live blog On August 29, the USFDA issued a Form 483 with five observations on inspecting Unit-I, an API manufacturing facility of the company’s subsidiary Apitoria Pharma at Sangareddy, Telangana, during August 21–29. The observations were procedural in nature, and no data integrity issues were reported. The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 1,592.55 and a 52-week low of Rs 994.35 on 13 September, 2024 and 07 April, 2025, respectively. Currently, the stock is trading 34.91 percent below its 52-week high and 4.25 percent above its 52-week low. The market capitalisation of the company stands at Rs 60,205.90 crore.

title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a positive start on September 8,  tracking GIFT Nifty, which was hovering around 24,913.50 earlier this morning. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. Indian benchmark indices recovered smartly from the day's low to end flat in a volatile session on September 5. The selling was seen in the FMCG, IT, and realty names, while buying in the auto, metal, media and consumer discretionary stocks helped to regains the intraday losses. At close, the Sensex was down 7.25 points or 0.01 percent at 80,710.76, and the Nifty was up 6.70 points or 0.03 percent at 24,741. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices ended flat. For the week, BSE Sensex and Nifty added 1.2 percent each. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Up) The GIFT Nifty is trading higher at around 24,913.50, indicating a positive start for the day. Asian Equities (Gain) Asian markets traded mostly higher Monday as investors assessed Japan Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s resignation announcement over the weekend, and eyed key economic data in the region.  US Equities (Down) US stocks ended slightly lower on Friday as investors weighed economic worries against optimism over interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve after data showed U.S. job growth weakened sharply in August. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 220.43 points, or 0.48%, to 45,400.86, the S&P 500 lost 20.58 points, or 0.32%, to 6,481.50 and the Nasdaq Composite dropped 7.31 points, or 0.03%, to 21,700.39.  US Bond Yield (Up) The yield on 10-year Treasuries up 2 basis points at 4.09 percent and and 2-year Treasuries up 1 basis point at 3,52 percent.  Dollar Index (Down) The dollar was recouping some of its heavy losses, helped in part by the yen's weakness, after falling sharply on Friday on data that showed further cracks in the U.S. labour market.  Asian currencies (Mixed) Asian currencies were trading mixed in the early trade on Monday. However, on year-to-date basis, except Indonesian Rupiah, all other currencies gained between 2.7.5 percent.  Crude (Up) Oil prices climbed on Monday in early trade, trimming some of last week's losses, after OPEC+ agreed over the weekend to raise output at a slower pace from October on expectations of weaker global demand.  Gold (Flat) Gold traded near Friday’s record high, bolstered by an unexpectedly weak US employment report that saw wagers increase on the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates.  Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) offloaded equities worth Rs 1304 crore on September 5, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) purchased equities worth Rs 1821 crore on the same day.  Hope you're all set for today's trade. We wish you a profitable day ahead. title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Ashok Leyland, NMDC, Exide Industries, Eternal, Tega Industries, and others on September 08?

About 1,411 shares advanced compared to 1,365 declining shares on the NSE. The market is expected to see consolidation until it sees a breakout over the previous week's high. Such breakouts typically pave the way for strong trending moves, and this one is reinforced by a bullish candlestick with high volumes. title: Stocks to Watch Today: Adani Power, SpiceJet, JP Associates, Zydus Life, Aurobindo Pharma, BHEL, HFCL, Ceigall, ACME, Prime Focus in focus on 08 September
content: Let's catch up on the latest news from the stock market. From significant investments to major deals, order wins, acquisitions, and appointments, here’s a quick look at which stocks will be in focus in today's trade: Quarterly Earnings SpiceJet Q1 (Consolidated YoY) Loss stands at Rs 233.8 crore Vs Rs profit of Rs 158.3 crore Revenue drops 34.4% to Rs 1,120.2 crore Vs Rs 1,708.2 crore Stocks to Watch Jaiprakash Associates, Vedanta Mining conglomerate Vedanta beat Gautam Adani’s Group to make the winning bid for the acquisition of debt-ridden Jaiprakash Associates (JAL) for Rs 17,000 crore, reports PTI, quoting sources. The bid value translates into JAL’s net present value of Rs 12,505 crore. JAL has been dragged into insolvency proceedings after defaulting on loan payments. Zydus Lifesciences The US Food and Drug Administration (US FDA) conducted an inspection at the group’s injectable manufacturing plant at Vadodara, Gujarat, during August 25 – September 5, and concluded the inspection with 4 observations. There were no data integrity-related observations. Aurobindo Pharma The US FDA inspected the company’s Unit-XII, which includes both oral solids and injectable manufacturing units, at Bachupally, Telangana, from August 25 to September 5. Following the inspection, the US FDA issued a Form 483 with 8 observations. All observations are procedural in nature. Hyundai Motor India Hyundai Motor India announced that it will pass on the entire benefit of the recent Goods and Services Tax (GST) rate reduction on passenger vehicles (PVs) to its customers, slashing prices by up to Rs 2.4 lakh. The new prices will become effective on September 22, the date the revised GST rates come into effect. Mahindra and Mahindra The auto major announced a price cut across its ICE SUV portfolio, with immediate effect. Popular models like the Thar, Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700, and Scorpio-N will now be available with savings ranging from Rs 1.01 lakh to Rs 1.56 lakh, depending on the model and variant. Tata Motors Tata Motors announced a reduction in prices across its cars and SUVs by up to Rs 1.55 lakh, effective September 22, when the revised tax slabs come into force. PNB Housing Finance The Board has approved the issuance of non-convertible debentures (NCDs) up to a maximum amount of Rs 5,000 crore, with or without a green shoe option, on a private placement basis, in one or more tranches. Adani Power Adani Power has signed a shareholders’ agreement with Bhutan’s state-owned utility Druk Green Power Corp (DGPC) for setting up a 570 MW hydroelectric project at Wangchhu in Bhutan. The company and DGPC will jointly incorporate a public company (with 49:51 shareholding) in Bhutan to undertake the project. BHEL Bharat Heavy Electricals (BHEL) plans to develop a railway locomotive that runs on hydrogen fuel cells to generate electricity. It announced a long-term MoU with Singapore-based Horizon Fuel Cell Technologies. BHEL will have a 10-year exclusive agreement with Horizon to create this new domestic market segment. Welspun Living Sanjay Gupta has resigned as Chief Financial Officer of the company due to personal reasons, effective October 15. Adani Green Energy The company, through its various step-down subsidiaries, has operationalised 87.5 MW power projects at Khavda, Gujarat. With the commissioning of these plants, the company’s total operational renewable generation capacity has increased to 16,078 MW. HFCL The company, through its overseas wholly owned subsidiary, has secured export orders worth $40.65 million (equivalent to Rs 358.38 crore) for the supply of optical fiber cables. Ceigall India The company has received a Letter of Intent for the procurement of solar power under the Mukhyamantri Saur Krushi Vahini Yojana 2.0 for 147 MW from Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co (MSEDCL), for setting up grid-connected solar power projects at multiple locations in Maharashtra. Ideaforge Technology Shareholders have approved the appointment of Vipul Joshi as the Whole-time Director of the company, effective September 6, for a period of five years. Time Technoplast The company has entered a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the promoters of Ebullient Packaging for the acquisition of a 74% equity stake. EPPL is valued at an estimated enterprise value of approximately Rs 200 crore. Ratnamani Metals & Tubes Ratnamani Metals & Tubes has executed a Share Purchase Agreement with Technoenergy AG, Switzerland, to purchase its entire shareholding (40,000 shares of euro 10 each, at a purchase price of euro 4,00,000) in Ratnamani Trade EU AG, Switzerland. With this, Ratnamani Trade EU AG shall become a wholly owned subsidiary of the company. Exxaro Tiles Himanshu Shah has resigned as Chief Financial Officer of the company, effective September 6, to pursue a new professional opportunity outside the organization. Imagicaaworld Entertainment The company has executed a Business Transfer Agreement with Giriraj Enterprises and/or its partners for the purchase of a 6.65 MW solar power plant at Solapur, Maharashtra, owned by Giriraj Enterprises, on a slump sale basis on a going concern basis, for Rs 16 crore. Aegis Logistics The company announced a new capacity addition of 61,000 KL at Mumbai Port, with an investment of Rs 99.88 crore. Highway Infrastructure The Board has approved the appointment of Riddharth Jain as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the company, effective September 6. Max Estates The Board approved the execution of a Securities Purchase Agreement for the acquisition of Base Buildwell, a project SPV holding license and development rights over a 7.25-acre land parcel at Golf Course Extension Road, Gurugram. The acquisition will result in Base Buildwell becoming a wholly owned subsidiary of the company. ACME Solar Holdings The company has executed a share purchase agreement for the acquisition of 100% equity shares of AK Renewable Infra, for an enterprise value of Rs 79.25 crore. Sunteck Realty The Board has approved the issuance of 1,17,64,705 warrants, convertible into equivalent equity shares, at Rs 425 per warrant, amounting to Rs 500 crore through preferential allotment to promoters, promoter group, and non-promoters of the company. NTPC Green Energy The company has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with VOC Port Authority to set up a green hydrogen fueling station at VOC Port, along with hydrogen-based internal combustion engine trucks for port operations. Barbeque-Nation Hospitality Shareholders have approved the re-appointment of Rahul Agrawal as Chief Executive Officer and Whole-Time Director of the company for a period of five years, effective December 31, 2025. Bulk, Block Deals Prime Focus Ramesh Damani, Madhusudan Kela-owned Singularity AMC, Utpal Sheth, FE Securities, and Samyak Enterprises have acquired a 3.3% stake in the company for Rs 146.2 crore. Singularity Large Value Fund I, II, and III, owned by Madhusudan Kela and his son Yash Kela, bought 62.5 lakh shares (2.01%) at Rs 142.55 per share. Ramesh Shrichand Damani and Utpal H Sheth acquired 8 lakh shares and 17.5 lakh shares, respectively, at the same price. FE Securities and Samyak Enterprises purchased 14.55 lakh shares each. However, Marina IV (Singapore) and Marina IV sold 48.06 lakh shares (1.55%), while Augusta Investments I offloaded 54.48 lakh shares (1.75%) at the same price. As of June 2025, Augusta Investments I held an 8.86% stake, and Marina IV (Singapore) held a 7.55% stake in the company. Tourism Finance Corporation of India Aditya Kumar Halwasiya, a Non-Executive Director on the board, has acquired 6.7 lakh shares at Rs 346 per share, and 5.3 lakh shares at Rs 345.53 per share. This totals to a 1.29% stake worth Rs 41.49 crore. Zee Media Corporation Promoter entity Auv Innovations LLP acquired 50 lakh shares (0.8%) in Zee Media at Rs 12.37 per share from Miloeux Media & Entertainment.
